How to Install libpam0g on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • libpam0g

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install libpam0g on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing libpam0g on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall libpam0g in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install libpam0g, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install libpam0g Using apt

To install libpam0g in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install libpam0g using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install libpam0g

The installation of libpam0g might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install libpam0g Using apt-get

To install libpam0g using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install libpam0g.

sudo apt-get -y install libpam0g

Install libpam0g Using Synaptic

To install libpam0g using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install libpam0g on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for libpam0g. This will display the libpam0g package in the package window, now to install libpam0g, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the libpam0g package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of libpam0g.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install libpam0g Using aptitude

To install libpam0g on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of libpam0g.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install libpam0g using the command aptitude install libpam0g.

sudo aptitude -y install libpam0g

How to Upgrade libpam0g on debian

If you want to upgrade the libpam0g package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade libpam0g using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade libpam0g to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade libpam0g.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade libpam0g sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade libpam0g

Upgrade libpam0g using Aptitude

To upgrade libpam0g using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade libpam0g.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade libpam0g

Upgrade libpam0g using Synaptic

To upgrade libpam0g using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for libpam0g, now right-click libpam0g, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade libpam0g just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall libpam0g on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall libpam0g from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just libpam0g, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove libpam0g

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of libpam0g

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of libpam0g you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge libpam0g

Remove libpam0g using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall libpam0g using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for libpam0g, right-click the libpam0g package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall libpam0g click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install libpam0g on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade libpam0g using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of libpam0g then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
